other_tests.findings: Confirmed a burst fracture at the twelfth thoracic vertebral body with retropulsion of an osseous fragment into the spinal canal.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Five months postoperatively, the patient was walking without assistive devices, had no pain, had recovered full strength in the lower extremities, and denied any fecal incontinence. Urinary incontinence had improved. Radiographs showed excellent position of the instrumentation and early healing of the bone graft.

other_tests.findings: Single-shot fluoroscopic images localized the incisional site over the tenth rib and confirmed the location of the fractured vertebra.
Excellent position of the instrumentation and early healing of the bone graft.
